function.description: Splits `string` into a LIST of strings, based on the provided `delimiter`.

parameterDescriptions.parameterDescription: The string that will be split.
The delimiter that will be used to split `string`.
If set to true empty entries will also be added to the results. (default is false)

function.longDescription:
`delimiter` is interpreted as a Java Regular expression. Since all backslash "\\" characters will be interpreted (by the Xill IDE) as an escape character, all backslashes you want to be evaluated by the regex have to be doubled. This means that "\\\\" would denote a single literal backslash "\\" and "\\*" would denote a literal asterisk "*".
Read more about Java regular expressions [here] (https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/regex/Pattern.html).
